intro: Fumaria muralis var. laeta, commonly known as the wall rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in rocky or disturbed soils and is often found growing on walls or in cracks in the ground. Due to its delicate appearance and preference for specific habitats, it is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
